page.title: 14BROOMFIELD HOSPITAL I
page.content: { Broomfield Hospital}was built in the 1940's on the site which was owned by the Nash family.The mansion which they lived in is now the nurses' residence. It was built as a{Tuberculosis {Hospital}and because of this there were two south facing wings so that the beds could be pushed out onto verandahs for fresh air,as doctors thought this would help the patients. The Hospital used to grow their own vegetables for the patients and staff. In June-July 1983 the C.A.T. Scanner was officially opened by {Princess Anne,}but it was running twelve months before hand.It cost over one million pounds.The money for this event was raised by the public and some charities.The C.A.T. Scanner is a large X-ray machine which examines the whole of your body whilst rotating you round and round.
